subanswer.text:
In Zoroastrianism, Ahura Mazda is considered the supreme God, the creator of the universe, and the source of all that is good. He is seen as wise, just, and uncreated. In contrast to polytheistic religions, Ahura Mazda is unique and without equal. He is the embodiment of truth and wisdom, and he battles against Angra Mainyu, the principle of evil. So the nature of Ahura Mazda in Zoroastrianism is as the supreme being and the ultimate force of goodness. The answer is: true.
